gurmukhi: ik ju`Jyq hwQI ] ik is`Jyq swQI ] ik B`gyq vIrM ] ik l`gyq qIrM ]262]
transliteration: Ki Jujjhet Haathee|| Ki Sijjhet Saathee|| Ki Bhagget Vderan|| Ki Lagget Tderan||262||
translation: The warriors are fighting with the elephants after killing the enemies; they are running away after being hit by the arrows.262.

gurmukhi: ik r`jyq rosM ] ik q`jyq hosM ] ik Ku`lyq kysM ] ik fu`lyq BysM ]263]
transliteration: Ki Rajjet Rosan|| Ki Tajjet Hosan|| Ki Khullet Kesan|| Ki Dullet Bhesan||263||
translation: The warriors are lying down unconscious and in their fury; their hair have been loosened and their attires have been damaged.263.

gurmukhi: ik ju`Jyq hwQI ] ik lu`Jyq swQI ] ik Cu`tyq qwjI ] ik g`jyq gwjI ]264]
transliteration: Ki Jujjhet Haathi|| Ki Lujjhet Saathee|| Ki Chhouttet Taajee|| Ki Gadjet Gadjee||264||
translation: The worriers have been destroyed while fighting with the elephants; the horses are roaming openly and the worriers are thundering. 264.

gurmukhi: ik Gu`mIq hUrM ] ik BuMmIq pUrM ] ik ju`Jyq vIrM ] ik l`gyq qIrM ]265]
transliteration: Ki Ghoummeet Hooran|| Ki Bhounmeet Pnran|| Ki Jujjhet Vderan|| Ki Lagget Tderan||265||
translation: The heavenly damsels are roaming over the whole earth; on being hit by the arrows the warriors are embracing martyrdom.265.

gurmukhi: ik c`lyq bwxM ] ik ru`kI idswxM ] ik JmkMq qygM ] ik nB jwn bygM ]266]
transliteration: Ki Chalat Hooran|| Ki Roukki Disaanan|| Ki Jhamkant Tegadg|| Ki Nabh Jaan Begadg||266||
translation: With the discharge of the arrows the directions have been hidden from view and the swords are gleaming high up in the sky.266.

gurmukhi: ik Cu`tyq gorM ] ik bu`Tyq ErM ] ik g`jyq gwjI ] ik p`lyq qwjI ]267]
transliteration: Ki Chouttet Goran|| Ki Boutthet Oran|| Ki Gadjet Gadjee|| Ki Pallet Taajee||267||
translation: The ghosts, arising from the graves, are coming towards the battlefield; the warriors are thundering and the horses are running.267.

gurmukhi: ik k`tyq AMgM ] ik if`gyq jMgM ] ik m`qyq mwxM ] ik lu`Jyq juAwxM ]268]
transliteration: Ki Kattet Anadg|| Ki Digget Janadg|| Ki Mattet Maanan|| Ki Lujjhet Juaanan||268||
translation: The warriors whose limbs have been chopped, are falling in the war arena and the intoxicated warriors are being killed.268.

gurmukhi: ik b`kyq mwrM ] ik c`kyq cwrM ] ik Fu`kyq FITI ] ik dyvy n pITI ]269]
transliteration: Ki Bakket Maaran|| Ki Chakket Chaaran|| Ki Dhoukket Dhithee|| Ki Deve Na Peethee||269||
translation: The cries of “kill, kill” are being heard in all the four directions; the warriors are closing in and are not backing out.269.

gurmukhi: ik G`lYq swNgM ] ik b`kYq bwNgM ] ik mu`CMq bMkI ] ik h`Tyq hMkI ]270]
transliteration: Ki Ghallait Saanadg|| Ki Bakkait Baanadg|| Ki Mouchchhant Bankee|| Ki Hatthet Hankee||270||
translation: They are striking blows with their lances, while shouting; the whiskers of those egoists are also charming.270.

gurmukhi: ik b`jyq FolM ] ik b`kyq bolM ] ik b`jy ngwry ] ik ju`ty hiTAwry ]271]
transliteration: Ki Bajjet Dholan|| Ki Bakket Bolan|| Ki Bajje Nagdare|| Ki Joutte Haeehidare||271||
translation: The drums are being played and the warriors are shouting; the trumpets are sounding and the persistent warriors are fighting with one another.271.

gurmukhi: auC`kyq qwjI ] hm`kyq gwjI ] Cut`kyq qIrM ] Bt`kyq BIrM ]272]
transliteration: Ouchchakket Taajee|| Hamakket Gadjee|| Chhoutakket Tderan|| Bhatakket Bhderan||272||
translation: The warriors are thundering, the horses are jumping, the arrows are being discharged and the fighters are going astray in the multitude.272.

gurmukhi: jhwN bIr ju`tYN ] sBY Twt T`tYN ] ik nyjy pl`tYN ] cmqkwr Cu`tYN ]273]
transliteration: Jahaan Beer Jouttain|| Sabhai Thaat Thattain|| Ke Neje Palattain|| Chamatkaar Chhouttain||273||
translation: Where the warriors are fighting in the battlefield, there is much pomp and show; when the lances are turned upside down, there appears a miracle (that all the warriors re killed).273.

gurmukhi: jhwN swr b`jY ] qhwN bIr g`jY ] imlY sMj s`jY ] n dÍY pYg B`jY ]274]
transliteration: Jahaan Saar Bajjai|| Tahaan Beer Gadjai|| Milai Sanj Sajjai|| Na Davi Paig Bhajjai||274||
translation: Where the steel is colliding, there the warriors are thundering, the armours are colliding with the armours, but the warriors are not retracing even two steps.274.
